page.title: 11BRANT BROUGHTON CRICKET CLUB
page.content: The Brant Broughton Cricket Club has had a chequered career. The earliest record we have is a set of accounts for 1927.We found out from these that the groundsman was paid 14/-(70p) each time he prepared the ground, which was then on a meadow to the west of the church. A cricket ball in that year cost 14/6(75p) whereas today it costs about Â£9.A cricket bat cost Â£2-2-0. The club ceased in 1939,but it seems to have started up again later in the war.It ceased for the second time in 1964 for reasons unknown.It was formed for the third time in 1967 but was disbanded the following year.In 1980 the club was started up again for the fourth time and is still functioning now. The present club belongs to two leagues - the Grantham Rural League and the Newark Evening League - and it plays friendly matches.
